powderhorn Mountain Resort

Colorado's Grand Mesa sits 12,000 feet above sea level and funnels the moisture in the atmosphere right onto Powerderhorn's ski slopes. Their ski season is abridged due to migrating elk, so get there before the end of March. In a good season, you'll be skiing knee-deep in fresh deep dry powder. And the feel is local-friendly. Go there often enough and you'll soon be recognizing faces and names of everyone else there.
